version_a.description: Fixed version with proper signature verification using ecrecover

ground_truth.root_cause: The withdraw function accepts signatures but does not verify them. It only checks the signature count without validating that signatures are from registered validators using ecrecover.
ground_truth.attack_vector: Attacker submits withdrawal request with fake signatures. Bridge checks signature count but not validity. Withdrawal is processed without proper validator authorization, allowing unauthorized fund extraction.

differential_details.changes_description_a: Added proper signature verification using ecrecover to recover signer addresses, then validates each signer is in the validators mapping, counts valid signatures, and requires the count meets REQUIRED_SIGNATURES threshold.
differential_details.changes_description_b: Only checks v.length >= REQUIRED_SIGNATURES without actually verifying signatures are valid or from registered validators.
differential_details.why_this_matters: Proper signature verification ensures only transactions approved by registered validators can be processed, preventing unauthorized withdrawals.
